summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to a judge (Nathan) regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It transmits a government letter requesting redactions to filings related to the defendant's application for a Rule 17(c) subpoena and includes attachments with proposed redactions to filings from defense counsel and the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: The email is addressed to Judge Nathan, indicating she is presiding over the case US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The case is US v. Maxwell, indicating Ghislaine Maxwell is the defendant in the referenced criminal proceeding.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Government Submits Redaction Request
events.description: The government submits a letter to the court requesting redactions to filings regarding the defendant's application for a Rule 17(c) subpoena in the Maxwell case.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email from a federal prosecutor to Judge Alison Nathan regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
The government is requesting redactions to filings related to Maxwell's application for a Rule 17(c) subpoena.
The attachments include proposed redactions to filings from Maxwell's defense counsel and the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.
The correspondence indicates ongoing pre-trial litigation concerning the scope of discovery and public disclosure in the Maxwell case.
